To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, Maschil<S>4905</S>, A Psalm of David<S>1732</S>, when Doeg<S>1673</S> the Edomite<S>130</S> came<S>935</S> and told<S>5046</S> Saul<S>7586</S>, and said<S>559</S> unto him, David<S>1732</S> is come<S>935</S> to the house<S>1004</S> of Ahimelech<S>288</S>. Why boastest<S>1984</S> thou thyself in mischief<S>7451</S>, O mighty<S>1368</S> man? the goodness<S>2617</S> of God<S>410</S> endureth continually<S>3117</S>.
Thy tongue<S>3956</S> deviseth<S>2803</S> mischiefs<S>1942</S>; like a sharp<S>3913</S> razor<S>8593</S>, working<S>6213</S> deceitfully<S>7423</S>.
Thou lovest<S>157</S> evil<S>7451</S> more than good<S>2896</S>; and lying<S>8267</S> rather than to speak<S>1696</S> righteousness<S>6664</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
Thou lovest<S>157</S> all devouring<S>1105</S> words<S>1697</S>, O thou deceitful<S>4820</S> tongue<S>3956</S>. <sup>O thou: or, and the deceitful tongue</sup>
God<S>410</S> shall likewise destroy<S>5422</S> thee for ever<S>5331</S>, he shall take thee away<S>2846</S>, and pluck thee out<S>5255</S> of thy dwelling place<S>168</S>, and root thee out<S>8327</S> of the land<S>776</S> of the living<S>2416</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>. <sup>destroy: Heb. beat thee down</sup>
The righteous<S>6662</S> also shall see<S>7200</S>, and fear<S>3372</S>, and shall laugh<S>7832</S> at him:
Lo, this is the man<S>1397</S> that made<S>7760</S> not God<S>430</S> his strength<S>4581</S>; but trusted<S>982</S> in the abundance<S>7230</S> of his riches<S>6239</S>, and strengthened<S>5810</S> himself in his wickedness<S>1942</S>. <sup>wickedness: or, substance</sup>
But I am like a green<S>7488</S> olive tree<S>2132</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of God<S>430</S>: I trust<S>982</S> in the mercy<S>2617</S> of God<S>430</S> for ever<S>5769</S> and ever<S>5703</S>.
I will praise<S>3034</S> thee for ever<S>5769</S>, because thou hast done<S>6213</S> it: and I will wait<S>6960</S> on thy name<S>8034</S>; for it is good<S>2896</S> before thy saints<S>2623</S>.
